who has led Google for a decade, will become executive chairman focusing on external relations, deals and government relations.New Yorker writer Ken Auletta , who has written a book on the company, reported Friday that Eric Schmidt had been nudged aside. " Ken Auletta said that after losing out to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin over the company's China policy a year ago, " Eric Schmidt lost some energy and focus. " Eric Schmidt was also criticized for allowing Google to be overtaken by Facebook, for the company's increasingly frequent privacy scandals and its increasing internal bureaucracy. Together with the co- founders, he decided to step aside.In announcing the move Thursday, Eric Schmidt said that the company no longer needed his "adult supervision and that Page, 38, was ready to run the world's leading internet company. April 4, co-founder Larry Page will take over as Google's CEO, while Eric Schmidt will take on the role of executive chairman, the company just announced. Google says it's making the changes to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility at the top of the company but there were no signs that anything was amiss at the triumvirate that has led the company since 2001. The news came as part of the company's Q4 earnings results.
